Package org.jlab.coda.jevio

Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.coda.jevio.Utilities
public final class Utilities extends Object
This class contains generally useful methods.

    • getEvioVersion

      public static int getEvioVersion(File file) throws EvioException
      Get the evio version of the given file.
      Parameters:
      file - file name.
      Returns:
      the evio version of the given file.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if version cannot be found.

    • getEvioVersion

      public static int getEvioVersion(ByteBuffer headerData) throws EvioException
      Get the evio version of the given evio header in ByteBuffer form. The buffer can contain any evio version and be a file, record, or block header. Side effect is that the headerData arg is set to the correct endian order.
      Parameters:
      headerData - ByteBuffer object with at least 8 words (32 bytes) of data.
      Returns:
      the evio version of the given data.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if version cannot be found.

    • generateBaseFileName

      public static int generateBaseFileName(String baseName, String runType, StringBuilder newNameBuilder) throws EvioException

      This method generates part of a file name given a base file name as an argument.

      The base file name may contain up to 3, C-style integer format specifiers using "d" and "x" (such as %03d, or %x). If more than 3 are found, an exception will be thrown. If no "0" precedes any integer between the "%" and the "d" or "x" of the format specifier, it will be added automatically in order to avoid spaces in the returned string. See the generateFileName(String, int, int, long, int, int, int) documentation to understand the exact way that run number, split number and stream id are substituted into the specifiers.

      The base file name may contain characters of the form $(ENV_VAR) which will be substituted with the value of the associated environmental variable or a blank string if none is found.

      Finally, the base file name may contain occurrences of the string "%s" which will be substituted with the value of the runType arg or nothing if the runType is null.
      Parameters:
      baseName - file name to start with
      runType - run type/configuration name
      newNameBuilder - object which contains generated base file name
      Returns:
      number of C-style int format specifiers found in baseName arg.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if baseName arg is improperly formatted; if baseName or newNameBuilder arg is null

    • generateFileName

      public static String generateFileName(String fileName, int specifierCount, int runNumber, long split, int splitNumber, int streamId, int streamCount) throws IllegalFormatException

      This method generates a complete file name from the previously determined baseFileName obtained from calling generateBaseFileName(String, String, StringBuilder). If evio data is to be split up into multiple files (split > 0), numbers are used to distinguish between the split files with splitNumber.

      The given fileName may contain up to 3, C-style int format specifiers which will be substituted with runNumber, splitNumber and streamId in the manner described below.

      • If file is to be split:
        • If no specifiers:
          • for one stream, splitNumber is tacked onto the end of the file name as .<splitNumber>
          • for multiple streams, streamId and splitNumber are tacked onto the end of the file name as .<streamId>.<splitNumber>
          • No run numbers are ever tacked on without a specifier
        • If 1 specifier:
          • add runNumber according to specifier
          • for one stream, splitNumber is tacked onto the end of the file name as .<splitNumber>
          • for multiple streams, streamId and splitNumber are tacked onto the end of the file name as .<streamId>.<splitNumber>
        • If 2 specifiers:
          • add runNumber according to first specifier
          • for one stream, add splitNumber according to second specifier
          • for multiple streams, add splitNumber according to second specifier, but place <streamId>. just before the splitNumber
        • If 3 specifiers:
          • add runNumber according to first specifier
          • add streamId according to second specifier add splitNumber according to third specifier
      • If file is NOT split:
        • If no specifiers:
          • streamId is tacked onto the end of the file name as .<streamId>
          • No run numbers are ever tacked on without a specifier.
        • If 1 specifier:
          • add runNumber according to specifier
          • for multiple streams, streamId is tacked onto the end of the file name as .<streamId>
        • If 2 specifiers:
          • add runNumber according to first specifier
          • remove second specifier
          • for multiple streams, streamId is tacked onto the end of the file name as .<streamId>
        • If 3 specifiers:
          • add runNumber according to first specifier
          • add streamId according to second specifier
          • remove third specifier
      If there are more than 3 specifiers, NO SUBSTITUTIONS ARE DONE on the extra specifiers.
      Parameters:
      fileName - file name to use as a basis for the generated file name.
      specifierCount - number of C-style int format specifiers in baseFileName arg.
      runNumber - CODA run number.
      split - number of bytes at which to split off evio file.
      splitNumber - number of the split file.
      streamId - number of the stream id.
      streamCount - total number of streams.
      Returns:
      generated file name
      Throws:
      IllegalFormatException - if the baseFileName arg contains printing format specifiers which are not compatible with integers and interfere with formatting.

    • bufferToFile

      public static void bufferToFile(String fileName, ByteBuffer buf, boolean overWriteOK, boolean addBlockHeader) throws IOException, EvioException
      This method takes a byte buffer and saves it to the specified file, overwriting whatever is there.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of file to write
      buf - buffer to write to file
      overWriteOK - if true, OK to overwrite previously existing file
      addBlockHeader - if true, add evio block header for proper evio file format
      Throws:
      IOException - if trouble writing to file
      EvioException - if file exists but overwriting is not permitted; if null arg(s)

    • printStackTrace

      public static void printStackTrace()
      This method prints out the current stack trace.

    • printBuffer

      public static void printBuffer(ByteBuffer buf, int position, int words, String label)
      This method takes a byte buffer and prints out the desired number of words from the given position. Will not print out the extra 1, 2, or 3 bytes left at the end of the buffer. NOT thread-safe.
      Parameters:
      buf - buffer to print out
      position - position of data (bytes) in buffer to start printing
      words - number of 32 bit words to print in hex
      label - a label to print as header

    • printBytes

      public static void printBytes(ByteBuffer buf, int position, int bytes, String label)
      This method takes a byte buffer and prints out the desired number of bytes from the given position. Prints all bytes.
      Parameters:
      buf - buffer to print out
      position - position of data (bytes) in buffer to start printing
      bytes - number of bytes to print in hex
      label - a label to print as header

    • printBytes

      public static void printBytes(EvioNode node, int bytes, String label)
      This method takes an EvioNode and prints out the desired number of bytes from the backing array at the given node's position, in hex. Prints all bytes.
      Parameters:
      node - node with backing buffer to print out
      bytes - number of bytes to print in hex
      label - a label to print as header

    • printBytes

      public static void printBytes(byte[] array, int offset, int bytes, String label)
      This method takes a byte array and prints out the desired number of bytes from the given index. Prints all bytes.
      Parameters:
      array - byte array to print out
      offset - offset into array to start printing
      bytes - number of bytes to print in hex
      label - a label to print as header

    • printBytes

      public static void printBytes(String fileName, long offset, int bytes, String label)
      This method takes a file and prints out the desired number of bytes from the given offset.
      Parameters:
      fileName - file to print out
      offset - offset into file to start printing
      bytes - number of bytes to print in hex
      label - a label to print as header

    • readBytes

      public static void readBytes(String fileName, ByteBuffer buf) throws EvioException
      This method reads part of a file into a ByteBuffer. The buffer's position will be at the end of the data that is read. The caller will have to flip the buffer to read it.
      Parameters:
      fileName - file to read from.
      buf - buffer to write into.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if file not found, is a directory, or could not be read; if bad file name or unable to do I/O.

    • stringToBank

      public static byte[] stringToBank(String text, short tag, byte num, ByteOrder order)
      Method to create a byte array representing a bank with one string as data. Not the most efficient implementation.
      Parameters:
      text - string to use as data.
      tag - bank's tag.
      num - bank's num.
      order - byte order of returned bank. If null use big endian.
      Returns:
      byte array containing evio bank with string data. Null if text is null.

    • bankToBytes

      public static byte[] bankToBytes(EvioBank bank, ByteOrder order)
      Method to create a byte array representing a bank.
      Parameters:
      bank - bank to encode.
      order - byte order of returned bank. If null use big endian.
      Returns:
      byte array containing evio bank as byte array. Null if bank is null.

    • nodeToEvent

      public static EvioEvent nodeToEvent(EvioNode node) throws EvioException
      This method takes an EvioNode object and converts it to an EvioEvent object.
      Parameters:
      node - EvioNode object to EvioEvent
      Returns:
      EvioEvent object created from EvioNode arg.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if node is not a bank or cannot parse node's buffer

    • powerOfTwo

      public static int powerOfTwo(int x, boolean roundUp)
      Return the power of 2 closest to the given argument.
      Parameters:
      x - value to get the power of 2 closest to.
      roundUp - if true, round up, else down
      Returns:
      -1 if x is negative or the closest power of 2 to value

    • toEvents

      public static List<EvioEvent> toEvents(String xmlString) throws EvioException
      This method takes a string representation of evio events (each starting with lt; event gt;) and converts them to a list of EvioEvent objects.
      Parameters:
      xmlString - xml format string to parse
      Returns:
      list of EvioEvent objects constructed from arg
      Throws:
      EvioException - if xml is not in proper format

    • toEvents

      public static List<EvioEvent> toEvents(String xmlString, int maxEvents, int skip, EvioXMLDictionary dictionary, boolean debug) throws EvioException
      This method takes a string representation of evio events (each starting with lt; event gt;) and converts them to a list of EvioEvent objects.
      Parameters:
      xmlString - xml format string to parse
      maxEvents - max number of events to return
      skip - number of events to initially skip over
      dictionary - dictionary object
      debug - true for debug output
      Returns:
      list of EvioEvent objects constructed from arg
      Throws:
      EvioException - if xml is not in proper format

    • getDataType

      public static DataType getDataType(String type)
      This method returns an XML element name given an evio data type.
      Parameters:
      type - evio data type
      Returns:
      XML element name used in evio event xml output

    • toXML

      public static String toXML(EvioNode node, boolean hex) throws EvioException
      This method takes an EvioNode object and converts it to a readable, XML String.
      Parameters:
      node - EvioNode object to print out
      hex - if true, ints get displayed in hexadecimal
      Returns:
      XML string.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if node is not a bank or cannot parse node's buffer
